summary: This document is an email chain from November 2021 regarding follow-up on subpoena returns from AT&T for phone records. The correspondence involves law enforcement and prosecution personnel seeking subscriber information and checking if certain phone numbers are associated with Jeffrey Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Byrne, Paul
persons.context: Copied on an email chain regarding subpoena returns for phone records, indicating NYPD involvement in the investigation.

events.title: Subpoena Issued for Phone Records
events.description: A subpoena was issued, likely to AT&T, for phone records as part of an ongoing investigation.

events.title: AT&T Records Received
events.description: Records from AT&T were received in response to the November 11 subpoena, but subscriber information was missing.

events.title: Follow-up on Subpoena Returns
events.description: Law enforcement followed up with AT&T to obtain missing subscriber records and requested analysis to see if phone numbers hit on Epstein/Maxwell numbers.

keyFacts: An active investigation involving subpoenas for phone records was ongoing as of November 2021.
Law enforcement was specifically seeking to determine if certain phone numbers were associated with Jeffrey Epstein or Ghislaine Maxwell.
AT&T initially provided records in response to a subpoena but omitted subscriber information, requiring follow-up.
The email chain indicates coordination between the FBI, U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), and the NYPD.
